content: NEW YORK Third Avenue Management and its founder Martin Whitman have reached a $14.25 million settlement of a lawsuit by investors who accused the well-known value investment firm of mismanaging a junk bond mutual fund that collapsed in December 2015.
name: Affiliated Managers Group Inc
title: Third Avenue in $14.25 million settlement over junk bond fund collapse

content: NEW YORK  March 31 Third Avenue Management and its founder Martin Whitman have reached a $14.25 million settlement of a lawsuit by investors who accused the well-known value investment firm of mismanaging a junk bond mutual fund that collapsed in December 2015.
name: Affiliated Managers Group Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Third Avenue in $14.25 mln settlement over junk bond fund collapse

content: NEW YORK  March 31 Third Avenue Management  its founder Martin Whitman and other defendants have reached a $14.25 million settlement of a lawsuit by investors in a junk bond mutual fund they oversaw that collapsed in December 2015.

title: Third Avenue in $14.25 mln settlement over junk bond fund collapse

content: BOSTON  June 6 Affiliated Managers Group Inc   a holding company for money management firms  said on Monday it will buy stakes in five hedge funds from Goldman Sachs for $800 million  sparking a  3.5 percent jump in the stock.
name: Affiliated Managers Group Inc
title: Affiliated Managers buys stakes in hedge funds from Goldman fund

content: BOSTON  June 6 Affiliated Managers Group Inc   a holding company for money management firms  said on Monday it will buy stakes in five hedge funds from Goldman Sachs Group Inc for $800 million  sparking a 3.5 percent jump in Affiliated Managers stock.
name: Affiliated Managers Group Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Affiliated Managers buys stakes in hedge funds from Goldman fund

content: BOSTON Executives at U.S. asset manager Affiliated Managers Group Inc on Tuesday sought to downplay the impact of the recent collapse of one its junk bond funds  but jittery investors continued to unload the company's stock.

title: AMG executives downplay impact of junk bond fund collapse

content: BOSTON  Feb 2 Executives at U.S. asset manager Affiliated Managers Group Inc on Tuesday sought to downplay the impact of the recent collapse of one its junk bond funds  but jittery investors continued to unload the company's stock.
name: Affiliated Managers Group Inc
title: UPDATE 1-AMG executives downplay impact of junk bond fund collapse
